page.title: 16Buildings in the Stone Area
page.content: Reference has already been made to churches in Oulton and Stone.Outside the East window of Stone St. Michael's Church is a mausolum where the Earl of St. Vincent, a colleague of Nelson, is buried. The earl was born at Meaford Hall to the N.W. of Stone.This building has an 18th C. shell-hood doorway, a French-style dormer and a garden front enriched by strapwork. There are some 18th C. houses and the Crown Hotel in Stone High Street.On the same side of the street is an elegant Tuscan-columned porch which has been blended into the frontage of a new supermarket. The oldest feature of the area is the Iron Age hill fort to the north of Stone at Bury Bank by the A.34 road.
